data.text: @Fiona_M_Russell A heathy 85 year old dying of a preventable disease is a failure of public health.
@Fiona_M_Russell Getting an early PCR test is almost impossible - don't assume it's easy and avalible.
@Fiona_M_Russell Protecting people from Covid19 is a part of public health.
@Fiona_M_Russell Looks like it’s just rare to die under 65 regardless of vaccination
@Fiona_M_Russell Fiona, love your tweets but the biggest issue at the moment is that @JulianBurnside had his dinner booking canceled…that’s the real pandemic
4/ For covid, getting 3 doses + 4th as indicated is lifesaving. For those at higher risk, take  precautions, get tested early if symptoms to access timely lifesaving treatment

3/ The average age of covid death in Australia is about 85y. Average life expectancy in Australia is about 83y. Every day about 400 people die (about 150,000 deaths per year)- many from preventable conditions & many die too young. Let’s invest in public health. https://t.co/ZeCQ4m5s4d
@kmwtalk @Fiona_M_Russell @RichmdSewerRat It is not about some people not be valuable but understanding the risks correctly so you can act accordingly.
